character.name: Santiago
character.full_name: Santiago (goes by 'Santi' with friends and family)

appearance.hair: short dark brown hair with a sharp fade cut on the sides, slightly longer on top and styled forward
appearance.build: slim athletic build, wiry and lean from riding motorcycle all day
appearance.nails: short, clean, slightly roughened from motorcycle work
appearance.distinguishing_features: Young Colombian delivery rider look, thin silver chain necklace always worn, small scar on left knuckle from a minor motorcycle fall, always has earbuds or over-ear headphones around his neck

character.occupation: Motorcycle delivery rider (Rappi platform) by day, aspiring DJ by night
character.living_situation: Rented room in a shared house with other young workers in the Kennedy neighborhood of Bogotá
character.transportation: Honda CB 125 motorcycle (red and black, slightly scratched), public transit (TransMilenio) when motorcycle is in the shop

style.sleep: Black athletic shorts and a loose gray cotton t-shirt, bare feet
style.delivery: Dark blue jeans, black hoodie layered under a black motorcycle jacket with reflective strips, black motorcycle gloves, red and black full-face helmet, bright orange Rappi insulated delivery backpack, black ankle boots
style.dj_outfit: Black slim-fit jeans, black graphic tee with electronic music logo, thin silver chain necklace, black canvas sneakers, over-ear headphones (black with blue accents)
style.casual: Gray jogger pants, white t-shirt, black slides (chanclas), silver chain necklace
style.post_shower: Blue towel wrapped around waist, smaller towel over one shoulder

background.education: Graduated from public high school in Soacha, no university — chose to work and save money for DJ equipment
background.family: Parents live in Soacha (south of Bogotá): mamá Gloria (~43, works in a laundry), papá Hernán (~46, construction worker), younger sister Camila (15, high school student). Visits family on Sundays.
background.hobbies: DJing and music production (reggaeton, electronic, guaracha), watching DJ tutorials on YouTube, riding motorcycle through Bogotá, playing mobile games, hanging out with friends at tiendas
background.languages: Spanish (primary), basic English learned from music and social media

notes.educational_context: This character represents a young Colombian working-class man hustling in Bogotá's gig economy while pursuing his passion for music. Shows motorcycle delivery work, urban Colombian life, shared housing, and youth music culture.
notes.cultural_context: Working-class Bogotá, Kennedy neighborhood. Colombian gig economy culture (Rappi delivery). Motorcycle culture prevalent in Colombian cities. Reggaeton and electronic music scene. Corrientazo (cheap set lunch) culture. Tinto (street coffee) culture. Tienda social life. Family bonds despite living apart. Sunday family visits. Soacha working-class origins. Young Colombian hustle culture — working multiple gigs to pursue dreams.
notes.pedagogical_goal: Help learners see diverse representation and learn vocabulary through a young Colombian delivery rider and aspiring DJ's daily activities including motorcycle riding, urban navigation, food delivery, music production, and working-class urban life. Supports bilingual Spanish-English learning with street-level Bogotá vocabulary.
